medical_history.chief_complaint: Decompensated liver disease associated with hypercoagulability in patients with primary biliary cirrhosis.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The first patient was diagnosed with stage II primary biliary cirrhosis (PBC) in 1996. Her symptoms worsened over time, leading to the diagnosis of cirrhosis by 2000. She developed severe abdominal pain six months after the diagnosis of portal venous thrombus, which extended to the superior mesenteric vein. The second patient was diagnosed with stage II PBC in 1998 and progressed to cirrhosis despite treatment, eventually developing painful deep venous thrombosis in the left leg one year later.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Both patients have primary biliary cirrhosis and heterozygosity for the factor V Leiden mutation.
medical_history.family_history: Both sisters have a history of primary biliary cirrhosis and the factor V Leiden mutation.
